348.title: Delhi Police issues traffic advisory for India-South Africa ODI tomorrow
348.article_body: Delhi Police has put in place special traffic arrangements in the wake of India-South Africa ODI match at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi on Tuesday. Commuters and visitors have been advised to follow the advisory for convenience. There will be traffic diversion for half an hour before the match as well as after the conclusion of the match.

349.title: Agra residents rename colony to ‘Keechad Nagar’ due to waterlogging
349.article_body: Residents of Agra have renamed their colonies to 'Keechad Nagar', 'Nala Sarovar', 'Badbu Vihar', 'Narak Puri' and 'Ghinona Nagar' in order to protest against damaged and waterlogged roads. "We've not received any help from the district administration," a local said. "We've complained everywhere, including MPs, MLAs and concerned departments, but all in vain," he added.

350.title: India bowl out Thailand for just 37 runs in Women's Asia Cup, 10 batters score 7 or less
350.article_body: India dismissed Thailand for just 37 runs in their Women's Asia Cup T20 2022 match. As many as ten Thailand batters scored seven runs or less. Nannapat Koncharoenkai top-scored for Thailand with 12(19). India's Sneh Rana registered bowling figures of 4-0-9-3, while Deepti Sharma and Rajeshwari Gayakwad took two wickets each. India chased down the target in six overs.

351.title: Ananya shares old pic with Rekha on her b'day, calls her 'ultimate queen'
351.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to Instagram Stories on Monday to share a post wishing Rekha on her birthday. "Then and now - forever a fan girl," she wrote while sharing photos of herself with the veteran actress. Ananya also called her "the ultimate queen". Rekha, who has appeared in over 180 projects so far, turned 68 on October 10.

352.title: Elephant, her calf die after being hit by Rajdhani Express in Assam
352.article_body: A mother elephant and her calf died after allegedly being hit by a Rajdhani Express train near Kharikatia railway station in Assam's Jorhat on Sunday night, forest officials confirmed on Monday. The forest department had alerted Railways about the movement of elephants in the area and requested them to control the train's speed, but they didn't oblige, an official said.

353.title: Gujarat & BJP have unbreakable ties: PM Modi in Anand
353.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Gujarat's Anand district on Monday said, "Gujarat and the BJP have unbreakable ties. Wherever there is talk of Gujarat, the BJP appears." He added, "Gujarat has always kept the lotus blossom. Everyone in the state understands that the Gujarat BJP stands for service." PM Modi was addressing a public rally at Vallabh Vidyanagar.

354.title: Order to be based on pollution levels: SC on Delhi firecracker ban
354.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to intervene in the case pertaining to the ban on firecrackers in Delhi, stating that an order would be passed based on air pollution levels. The petition said freedom of religion cannot be taken away on the pretext of the right to life. SC said the plea would be heard before the Diwali vacation.

355.title: HC directs DMRC to make ₹4,500 cr payment to Reliance Infra by Oct 31
355.article_body: Delhi HC has granted Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) time till October 31 to pay a ₹4,500-crore arbitration award to Reliance Infrastructure's subsidiary Delhi Airport Metro Express (DAME). The award relates to DMRC terminating a contract according to which, DAME was supposed to run Delhi Metro's Airport Express Line. DAME had invoked arbitration proceedings after DMRC terminated the contract.

356.title: Don't get complacent, Cong working silently this time: PM Modi to BJP workers
356.article_body: PM Narendra Modi warned BJP workers against becoming complacent about the Congress in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. During a Jan Vishwas Sammelan at Anand, PM Modi said, "The Congress is too silent, but don't assume it is finished...They are quietly going around villages to strengthen the ground," PM Modi said. He added, "[They are] doing 'khatla baithaks' [in villages]."

357.title: Mumbai man unplugs ATM during withdrawal to cheat bank of ₹2.77 lakh
357.article_body: An unidentified man has been booked for cheating a bank of ₹2.77 lakh by unplugging an ATM in Mumbai's Khar as soon as it dispensed cash. The unplugged ATM would register the transaction as cancelled and revert the amount back to the account. The police said the man was using a cloned debit card and a group may be involved.

358.title: Hyd man falls from 3rd floor while bending down to spit paan, dies
358.article_body: A 42-year-old Hyderabad man lost his balance and fell from the 3rd floor of his house while bending down to spit paan, reports said. He sustained a head injury and was shifted to Gandhi Hospital, where he died while undergoing treatment. The deceased was a daily wager and lived with his family, reports added.

359.title: 'Deeply concerned,' says India as Ukraine war escalates; issues statement
359.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Monday said, "India is deeply concerned at the escalation of conflict in Ukraine...targeting of infrastructure and deaths of civilians." It urged "immediate cessation of hostilities and...return to the path of diplomacy and dialogue". "India stands ready to support all...(de-escalation) efforts," said MEA, as Russia struck Ukrainian cities with missiles.

360.title: Guj AAP chief calls PM 'neech', says BJP attacks him because he's a Patidar
360.article_body: Responding to BJP's attack on him over a purported video in which he allegedly called PM Narendra Modi "neech", Gujarat AAP chief Gopal Italia has said he was being attacked because he was a Patidar. "The abusive and indecent language used by Sh. Gopal Italia is gender biased, misogynist and condemnable," NCW tweeted.

361.title: TCS reports net profit of ₹10,465 crore in Q2 FY23
361.article_body: TCS announced its results for the quarter ended September 2022, reporting a consolidated net profit of ₹10,465 crore at a year-on-year growth of 8.41%. TCS said the revenue from operations grew by 18.01% year-on-year to ₹55,309 crore, while revenue grew 4.83% compared to the previous quarter. In constant currency terms, the company saw a 15.4% year-on-year growth in revenue.

362.title: You're not qualified to understand: Sona to man criticising her version of 'Pasoori'
362.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra has responded to a man who took to Twitter to criticise her version of the song 'Pasoori'. The man said her voice "wasn't up to the mark". Sona responded, "Sorry to say...but you're not qualified to understand that it's more to do with a composition that can only sound good with a track & heavy music production."

363.title: Pune man uses hidden device during defence recruitment exam; held
363.article_body: Pune Police arrested a youth from Haryana after he was found in possession of a hidden mobile communication device wrapped in dressing tape during an examination for the recruitment of defence civilian employees on Sunday. The device was hidden inside the 22-year-old's shirt, an officer said, adding that the police is probing whether the arrested candidate has any accomplices.

364.title: Uddhav moves Delhi HC against EC order freezing Shiv Sena name, symbol
364.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction on Monday approached the Delhi High Court with an aim to quash the EC's order of freezing the party name and election symbol. Both parties were asked to shortlist three symbols and party name alternatives. Uddhav-led faction chose 'Trishul', 'Mashal' and 'Rising Sun' as symbols, while the Shinde-led faction chose 'Tutari', 'Gada' and 'Talwar'.

365.title: Was going to reject Rolex's role in Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram': Suriya
365.article_body: Actor Suriya, speaking about playing Rolex in Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram', revealed it was a last-minute decision to play the role. "I was going to...tell director Lokesh Kanagaraj, I won't do it. But I did it for one man," Suriya said referring to Kamal. "No matter what I'm doing in life, Kamal sir would've always been my inspiration," he added.

366.title: Police book 15 people for usurping land in Pune's Dighi
366.article_body: The police in Pune's Dighi district booked 15 people for allegedly preparing fake land documents for a plot that is owned by 62-year-old Khandu Balwant Pawar. The accused took over 20 guntas out of 44.50 guntas using fake documents and threatened the owner with dire consequences. A case was registered at the Dighi police station.

367.title: Over 100 Thane society residents go on hunger strike against builder
367.article_body: More than 100 residents of the Keshav Heights building in Kalwa, Thane, have gone on a hunger strike against the builder for allegedly not providing them with basic facilities. "Builder didn't even provide...garbage collection or disposal," said residents, adding that the parking did not have a fire extinguisher. The builder said he will meet with residents to resolve the issues.

368.title: Didn't have much experience in administration when I became Guj CM: PM
368.article_body: Addressing a rally in Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi said, "When I became Gujarat CM, I didn't have much experience in administration." "But it's our privilege that CM Bhupendra Patel has an experience of around 25 years ranging from panchayat to Assembly," he added. Notably, PM Modi laid the foundation stone of various development projects in Gujarat worth over ₹8,000 crore.

369.title: Share trader abducted for ₹20 cr ransom rescued by Pune Police, 4 arrested
369.article_body: The Pune Police rescued a share market trader and his friend, who were allegedly abducted for a ransom of ₹20 crore. The accused were criminals linked to the Gaja Marne gang. According to the probe, the victims were kept on the move along the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway in Pune. Four gang members were arrested in connection with the case.

370.title: Mulayam Singh's mortal remains reach his ancestral village Saifai in UP
370.article_body: The mortal remains of Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav reached his ancestral village Saifai on Monday evening. His last rites will be held on Tuesday. A convoy of 300 vehicles carried his body to Saifai from Gurugram's Medanta Hospital, where he passed away on Monday after a prolonged illness.

371.title: Strikes hit building that houses visa office in Kyiv: Germany
371.article_body: A building that houses the visa office of the German embassy in Kyiv was hit during Russian strikes on the city during Monday's rush hours, the German foreign ministry informed. It added that the office has not been used since the onset of the war in Ukraine. "Our colleagues at the Embassy in Kyiv are well," the foreign ministry stated.

372.title: Adani Group in talks to raise $10 billion for expansion plans: Report
372.article_body: Gautam Adani and his family have reportedly held talks with investors, including Singapore investment firms Temasek and GIC, to raise at least $10 billion to fund its expansion into clean energy, ports and cement businesses. Gautam Adani had previously said that Adani Group will invest over $100 billion over the next decade, most of it in the energy transition business.

373.title: Voice of socialist ideas fallen silent with Mulayam Singh's demise: Sonia
373.article_body: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Monday condoled the demise of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. She said the voice of socialist ideas has fallen silent with his demise. Yadav, the three-time former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister, passed away at the age of 82 at Medanta Hospital in Haryana's Gurugram on Monday.

374.title: Blackmailed with private video, 22-yr-old dies by suicide in Pune
374.article_body: A 22-year-old student died by suicide after he was blackmailed by an online fraudster who threatened to upload his private video on social media, officers said. The accused pretended to be a woman and shot an obscene video, following which he demanded money for not uploading it on social media platforms, said Assistant Police Inspector Berad.

375.title: Pathetic, in one word this is cheating: Venkatesh on video of Wade pushing Mark Wood
375.article_body: Reacting to Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade pushing England pacer Mark Wood while the latter was going for a catch, ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad tweeted, "Pathetic, in one word this is cheating, not in the spirit of the game." He added, "The sense of entitlement of these guys is unbelievable. Bulls****ing about spirit of the game when there is no spirit."

376.title: Initially, I was entertained: Radhika on rumours of her dating Tusshar Kapoor
376.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has revealed that those handling the promotions of her film 'Shor in the City' were responsible for the rumours about her dating co-star Tusshar Kapoor. "Initially, I was very entertained, because I got an article that I was apparently in Goa celebrating Valentine's Day with Tusshar and I was studying for my exams in London," she added.

377.title: Mulayam was deeply committed to socialist political traditions: Deve Gowda
377.article_body: Former PM HD Deve Gowda said that ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav was "deeply committed to the secular and socialist political traditions". Mulayam (82) died on Monday at a private hospital in Gurugram after a prolonged illness. Gowda's JD(S) and Mulayam's SP were formed after breaking out from the erstwhile Janata Dal (People's Party).

378.title: Large Indian traders avoid rupee trade with Russia due to sanction fears: Report
378.article_body: Large Indian lenders are reportedly reluctant to process direct rupee trade transactions with Russia due to fears of being targeted by sanctions by the US and Europe. Banks like State Bank of India and Punjab National Bank were among the lenders, according to sources. Two smaller lenders have moved to adopt a mechanism to settle trade with Russia in rupees.

379.title: 4 arrested for plotting to kill Uttarakhand Minister Saurabh Bahuguna
379.article_body: Four people have been arrested for allegedly planning to kill Uttarakhand Cabinet Minister Saurabh Bahuguna. Police said the conspiracy was hatched by a man jailed in Haldwani prison. He held the minister responsible for his imprisonment and was in contact with some shooters from Uttar Pradesh to execute the plan.

380.title: TCS adds 35,000 freshers in the first half of FY23, says 'all job offers honoured'
380.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) onboarded 35,000 freshers during the first half of FY23 and 20,000 of these were onboarded in Q2 itself, the company said on Monday. In comparison, the company hired 43,000 freshers in the first half of FY22. TCS' Chief HR Officer Milind Lakkad said that TCS has honoured all job offers the company had made.

381.title: 23-yr-old tries to steal Ex-Maha CM's phone from Mumbai-bound train; arrested
381.article_body: A 23-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly trying to steal the phone of former Maharashtra CM Sushil Kumar Shinde, who was travelling by train from his hometown of Solapur to Mumbai. Shinde's daughter caught the accused red-handed when the former Minister had gone to the toilet, reports said. The accused was caught and handed over to the GRP.

382.title: Freedom being misused: India on Khalistani activity in Canada
382.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said that India has flagged issues related to Khalistani forces operating out of Canada. Jaishankar said, "We have flagged the need to ensure that freedoms in a democratic society are not misused by forces which actually advocate violence and bigotry." The minister reminded Canada of the "responsibility that democracies have to other democracies".

383.title: Ready to step up aid to Kyiv, France says after latest Russian strikes
383.article_body: In a call with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy, French President Emmanuel Macron expressed France's commitment to step up military aid for Ukraine's war efforts against Russia, the Elysee said. The call took place after Russia reportedly struck multiple Ukrainian cities during rush hour on Monday. This came following an explosion on a bridge that connects mainland Russia to Crimea.

384.title: Snapchat launches 'Family Centre' feature for parental controls in India
384.article_body: Snapchat has rolled out parental controls in India in the form of in-app tool called 'Family Centre'. These controls will allow parents of children between 13-18 years of age to see who they are friends with and who they have messaged without revealing the content of the messages. Parents can confidentially report suspicious accounts on 'Family Centre', the company said.

385.title: Student boarding BMTC bus injured after being crushed under its rear wheel
385.article_body: A 23-year-old post-graduate student sustained grievous injuries after she slipped while boarding a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) bus and was crushed under one of its rear wheels near the Jnana Bharathi campus of Bangalore University. Students at the university held a protest over the driver's alleged carelessness. The driver has been arrested and the bus has been impounded.

386.title: PMC blacklists 13 contractors over poor quality of roads in Pune
386.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has blacklisted 13 contractors for carrying out poor quality work and fined seven deputy engineers of the road department over poor condition of roads in Pune. The contractors and engineers have been fined ₹5,000 and ₹15,000, respectively. This comes after PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar inspected the bad condition of the roads after receiving complaints from people.

387.title: Violence reported between 2 communities in Kolkata; Section 144 imposed
387.article_body: A clash broke out between two communities at Mominpur in Kolkata on the night of October 8 over Milad-un-Nabi flags. Many houses in the Mayurbhanj area were ransacked and cars were destroyed the next day. Prohibitory orders under Section 144 have been imposed in the Ekbalpur area till October 12 in view of the law and order situation.

388.title: Not right to pit films against each other: Vikram Vedha directors on 'Ponniyin...'
388.article_body: Director duo Pushkar and Gayathri said the release of 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' has not affected the box office collection of their film 'Vikram Vedha'. "I don't think the presence of another big film is going to hurt either one of the movies majorly...it's not right to pit movies against each other," they added. Both films had released on September 30.

389.title: Name of Shinde & his MLAs will be written in ‘black ink’: Sena
389.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, in an editorial in its mouthpiece 'Samaana', said that the name of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and his MLAs will be written in "black ink". Shiv Sena on Monday said that it is a bushfire that can never be extinguished and promised to bounce back from EC's decision to freeze the party's name and symbol.

390.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 with over 2,600 kg of illegal crackers
390.article_body: Delhi Police's Crime Branch has arrested two men and seized 2,625 kg of illegal firecrackers from their possession, which were to be sold during the upcoming festival season, officials said on Monday. Police said that one of the accused had been in the firecrackers business since 2018, while the other had been working since 2020 and got paid ₹12,000.

391.title: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin asks Centre to treat all languages equally
391.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin warned the Centre against the imposition of the Hindi language and asked the government to treat all languages equally. "India has unity in diversity...We should come to a level where all languages are official languages...We urge the Prime Minister and government to stop Hindi imposition and save India's unity," said Stalin.

392.title: Sanjay Raut's custody extended till October 17 in land scam case
392.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's judicial custody has been extended till October 17 in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. He was arrested by the ED on August 1 after over six hours of questioning in the ₹1,034-crore case. Earlier in August, Raut’s wife was also questioned by the probe agency in connection with the same case.

393.title: Dharmendra shares pic from 'Sholay', calls Big B 'most talented actor'
393.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra Deol took to Twitter and shared an old picture with actor Amitabh Bachchan from 'Sholay'. "I got news from Rajshri Productions that you're doing a film ('Uunchai') with them...Most talented actor and the best production house together," Dharmendra tweeted along with the photo. Dharmendra further wished Amitabh for 'Uunchai', which is directed by Sooraj Barjatya.

394.title: Iranian drones used in Russia's attack on Ukraine: Zelenskyy
394.article_body: After Russia bombed multiple Ukrainian cities on Monday, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that dozens of missiles and Iranian drones were used in the attack which targeted civilians and energy facilities. The timing and goals of the explosions "were specially chosen to cause as much damage as possible", he added. He also urged people to stay in shelters today.

395.title: It takes two to tango: Shreyas to Ishan who missed his ton in India's win vs SA
395.article_body: Reacting to Ishan Kishan expressing disappointment for not scoring a hundred in the second South Africa ODI, Shreyas Iyer praised the 24-year-old and said, "We won the match...it takes two to tango, you'll get one in the next game." Ishan had said, "What do you have to say about scoring a hundred, meanwhile I missed [mine] at my home ground."

396.title: Tabu, Kriti Sanon joins Kareena in Rhea Kapoor's comedy film: Report
396.article_body: Tabu and Kriti Sanon will reportedly share screen space with Kareena Kapoor Khan in Rhea Kapoor's upcoming comedy film. The project will mark Kareena's first collaboration with Kriti and Tabu. Talking about the movie, Kareena had previously shared that she's "super excited" about the film, which she said is "slightly different" than Rhea's previous production venture, 'Veere Di Wedding'.

397.title: Sajid flashed his private part at me, asked me to rate it on 0 to 10 scale: Sherlyn Chopra
397.article_body: Actress Sherlyn Chopra took to Twitter and alleged that filmmaker Sajid Khan had flashed his "private part" at her and asked her to rate it on a scale of 0 to 10. She added, "I’d like to enter into the house of Big Boss and give him the rating! Let India watch how a survivor deals with her molester!"

398.title: School manager in UP sends obscene messages, pics to woman; booked
398.article_body: An FIR has been registered against the manager of a private school in UP for allegedly sending obscene photographs and messages to a woman, police said on Sunday. The woman's father alleged that the accused sent obscene photographs and messages on her daughter's phone on October 5, said Manoj Kumar Singh, Station House Officer, Ujhani.

399.title: Armed confrontation is not an option: Taiwanese Prez to China
399.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Monday said that she wants to "make it clear" to authorities in China that "armed confrontation is absolutely not an option". She also said that it's "regrettable" that China has escalated military tensions and threatened the peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait and the region. Ing-wen made the remarks during her National Day address.

400.title: Apple iPhone 5c to be added to obsolete product list on Nov 1: Report
400.article_body: Apple iPhone 5c will be added to the obsolete product list on November 1, resulting in discontinuation of all service programs for the model, according to reports. The firm sent a memo to authorised Apple resellers mentioning the same. Apple's memo also states that the third-generation iPad mini with Wi-Fi and TD-LTE will also be marked 'obsolete' on November 1.

401.title: Video shows journalist ducking for cover live on air as missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv
401.article_body: A video showing the moment a BBC journalist ducked for cover during a live broadcast which was interrupted as Russian missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv on Monday, has gone viral. The reporter, Hugo Bachega, could be seen rushing to take shelter after hearing the sound of a missile overhead. BBC said it re-established contact with the journalist over an hour later.

402.title: Would die on spot if I ever encounter a ghost: Katrina Kaif
402.article_body: Katrina Kaif said she "would die on the spot" if she'd ever encounter a ghost in real life. Katrina plays a ghost in 'Phone Bhoot', which also stars Ishaan Khatter and Siddhant Chaturvedi. When asked who'd she haunt if she was a ghost for a day, Katrina said she'd haunt Priyanka Chopra "to see how she does so much work".

403.title: Delhi reports more than 300 cases of Dengue in first 5 days of Oct
403.article_body: Delhi has reported a rise in dengue cases as 321 people were diagnosed with the infection in the first five days of October, data showed. Delhi reported 693 dengue cases in the month of September, taking the national capital's total tally to 1,258 so far this year. However, no dengue-related deaths have been reported in Delhi this year till now.

404.title: ED moves SC against HC order quashing probe against Indiabulls
404.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has moved the Supreme Court (SC) to challenge the Delhi High Court's (HC) order quashing a probe against home finance firm Indiabulls. According to ED, Indiabulls loaned money to entities to increase its stocks' market price. The Delhi HC had quashed the ED probe against Indiabulls and held that no coercive action be taken against the firm.
